schema.title: AIRR Schema
schema.description: Schema definitions for AIRR standards objects

study.study_title: Human islet T cells are highly reactive to preproinsulin in type 1 diabetes
study.inclusion_exclusion_criteria: Donors were included if they met the following criteria: Pancreas from donors with type 1 diabetes at any age, and any disease duration (History of dialysis is ruled out on donors with a disease duration greater than 7 years). Pancreas from any donor at 30 years or younger of age, with a BMI of less than 30 where the cause of death was related to Diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) and/or has an HbA1c of 6.5 or higher. Pancreas from autoantibody positive donors at 30 years or younger of age, with at least 1 or more autoantibodies (for those Organ Procurement Organizations (OPOs) that screen with nPOD). Control donors are age and sex-matched.
study.grants: This work was supported by the National Institutes of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (R01DK099317, R01DK032083, R01DK108868, DP3DK110845), JDRF (2-SRA-2018-480-S-B and 5-SRA-2018-557-Q-R), and the Leona M. and Harry B. Helmsley Charitable Trust (2018PG-T1D053).
study.lab_address: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus,  School of Medicine, Aurora, CO, 80045, USA

sample.biomaterial_provider: Vanderbilt University Medical Center/University of Pittsburgh
sample.tissue_processing: Islet tissues were cultured in RPMI supplemented with Penicillin-Streptomycin, human AB+ serum, interleukin-2, interleukin-15, interleukin-7 for two days. The islet tissues were dispersed to single cells by treating with Liberase DL.
sample.cell_isolation: Cell samples were stained with anti-CD3, anti-CD4, and anti-CD8 antibodies, and CD3+CD4+ and CD3+CD8+ cells were identified and sorted into an each well of 96-well plates using the MoFlo Astrios EQ flow cytometric sorter
sample.cell_processing_protocol: Single cells were directly sorted into an each well of 96-well plates containing RT-PCR buffer with NP-40 to be lysed.
sample.library_generation_protocol: Barcoded PCR amplicons were sequenced on Illumina
sample.sequencing_facility: University of Colorado Genomics Shared Resource, Aurora, CO, USA

data_processing.data_processing_protocols: In house scripts were used to analyze sequences by IMGT/HighV-QUEST

sample.tissue_processing: Islet tissues were cultured in RPMI supplemented with Penicillin-Streptomycin, human AB+ serum, interleukin-2, interleukin-15, interleukin-7 for three days. The islet tissues were dispersed to single cells by treating with Liberase DL.
sample.cell_isolation: Cell samples were stained with anti-CD3, anti-CD4, and anti-CD8 antibodies, and CD3+CD4+ and CD3+CD8+ cells were identified and sorted into an each well of 96-well plates using the MoFlo Astrios EQ flow cytometric sorter
sample.cell_processing_protocol: Single cells were directly sorted into an each well of 96-well plates containing RT-PCR buffer with NP-40 to be lysed.
sample.library_generation_protocol: Barcoded PCR amplicons were sequenced on Illumina
sample.sequencing_facility: University of Colorado Genomics Shared Resource, Aurora, CO, USA

data_processing.data_processing_protocols: In house scripts were used to analyze sequences by IMGT/HighV-QUEST

study.study_title: Human islet T cells are highly reactive to preproinsulin in type 1 diabetes
study.inclusion_exclusion_criteria: Donors were included if they met the following criteria: Pancreas from donors with type 1 diabetes at any age, and any disease duration (History of dialysis is ruled out on donors with a disease duration greater than 7 years). Pancreas from any donor at 30 years or younger of age, with a BMI of less than 30 where the cause of death was related to Diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) and/or has an HbA1c of 6.5 or higher. Pancreas from autoantibody positive donors at 30 years or younger of age, with at least 1 or more autoantibodies (for those Organ Procurement Organizations (OPOs) that screen with nPOD). Control donors are age and sex-matched.
study.grants: This work was supported by the National Institutes of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (R01DK099317, R01DK032083, R01DK108868, DP3DK110845), JDRF (2-SRA-2018-480-S-B and 5-SRA-2018-557-Q-R), and the Leona M. and Harry B. Helmsley Charitable Trust (2018PG-T1D053).

diagnosis.medical_history: The donor had a 2 year history of diabetes (diagnosed Type 1) and was prescribed Novalog and Lantus. The donor had a family history of diabetes (Type 2, paternal grandfather).

sample.biomaterial_provider: Network for Pancreatic Organ Donors with Diabetes, Gainesville, FL, 32610, USA
sample.tissue_processing: Islet tissues were cultured in RPMI supplemented with Penicillin-Streptomycin, human AB+ serum, interleukin-2, interleukin-15, interleukin-7 for overnight or two days. The islet tissues were dispersed to single cells by treating with Liberase DL.
sample.cell_isolation: Cell samples were stained with anti-CD3, anti-CD4, and anti-CD8 antibodies, and CD3+CD4+ and CD3+CD8+ cells were identified and sorted into an each well of 96-well plates using the MoFlo Astrios EQ flow cytometric sorter
sample.cell_processing_protocol: Single cells were directly sorted into an each well of 96-well plates containing RT-PCR buffer with NP-40 to be lysed.
sample.library_generation_protocol: Barcoded PCR amplicons were sequenced on Illumina
sample.sequencing_facility: University of Colorado Genomics Shared Resource, Aurora, CO, USA

data_processing.data_processing_protocols: In house scripts were used to analyze sequences by IMGT/HighV-QUEST

study.study_title: Human islet T cells are highly reactive to preproinsulin in type 1 diabetes
study.inclusion_exclusion_criteria: Donors were included if they met the following criteria: Pancreas from donors with type 1 diabetes at any age, and any disease duration (History of dialysis is ruled out on donors with a disease duration greater than 7 years). Pancreas from any donor at 30 years or younger of age, with a BMI of less than 30 where the cause of death was related to Diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) and/or has an HbA1c of 6.5 or higher. Pancreas from autoantibody positive donors at 30 years or younger of age, with at least 1 or more autoantibodies (for those Organ Procurement Organizations (OPOs) that screen with nPOD). Control donors are age and sex-matched.
study.grants: This work was supported by the National Institutes of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (R01DK099317, R01DK032083, R01DK108868, DP3DK110845), JDRF (2-SRA-2018-480-S-B and 5-SRA-2018-557-Q-R), and the Leona M. and Harry B. Helmsley Charitable Trust (2018PG-T1D053).

study.study_title: Human islet T cells are highly reactive to preproinsulin in type 1 diabetes
study.inclusion_exclusion_criteria: Donors were included if they met the following criteria: Pancreas from donors with type 1 diabetes at any age, and any disease duration (History of dialysis is ruled out on donors with a disease duration greater than 7 years). Pancreas from any donor at 30 years or younger of age, with a BMI of less than 30 where the cause of death was related to Diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) and/or has an HbA1c of 6.5 or higher. Pancreas from autoantibody positive donors at 30 years or younger of age, with at least 1 or more autoantibodies (for those Organ Procurement Organizations (OPOs) that screen with nPOD). Control donors are age and sex-matched.
study.grants: This work was supported by the National Institutes of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (R01DK099317, R01DK032083, R01DK108868, DP3DK110845), JDRF (2-SRA-2018-480-S-B and 5-SRA-2018-557-Q-R), and the Leona M. and Harry B. Helmsley Charitable Trust (2018PG-T1D053).
study.lab_address: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus,  School of Medicine, Aurora, CO, 80045, USA

sample.biomaterial_provider: Network for Pancreatic Organ Donors with Diabetes, Gainesville, FL, 32610, USA
sample.tissue_processing: Islet tissues were cultured in RPMI supplemented with Penicillin-Streptomycin, human AB+ serum, interleukin-2, interleukin-15, interleukin-7 for ten days. The islet tissues were dispersed to single cells by treating with Liberase DL.
sample.cell_isolation: Cell samples were stained with anti-CD3, anti-CD4, and anti-CD8 antibodies, and CD3+CD4+ and CD3+CD8+ cells were identified and sorted into an each well of 96-well plates using the MoFlo Astrios EQ flow cytometric sorter
sample.cell_processing_protocol: Single cells were directly sorted into an each well of 96-well plates containing RT-PCR buffer with NP-40 to be lysed.
sample.library_generation_protocol: Barcoded PCR amplicons were sequenced on Illumina
sample.sequencing_facility: University of Colorado Genomics Shared Resource, Aurora, CO, USA

data_processing.data_processing_protocols: In house scripts were used to analyze sequences by IMGT/HighV-QUEST
